editorialNotes.standard: There’s a new king in town! Upgrade entire realms while battling an evil Dark King in the slick follow-up to Royal Match.
Brew and serve espressos, lattes, and other caffeinated concoctions while building a bustling business in this charming coffee shop sim from the makers of Good Pizza, Great Pizza.

ios.subtitle: From Farming Town to Big City

editorialNotes.standard: We wouldn’t be surprised if Subway Surfers kept its spot near the top of the charts for decades to come. Its heart is the key to its stamina, revealed in loving details lavished on cities from Chicago to Shenzhen in its World Tours or in the lovable ruffians awarded in its frequent events. It’s a cinch to pick up, but we’re still finding new ways to master it years and miles later.

Open and stack the new states

editorialNotes.standard: Hipster Whale's Apple Design Award–winning game takes a timeless arcade formula—cross a road bustling with traffic and deadly obstacles—and transforms it into an adorable infinite runner. As you progress, you’ll unlock new characters with wildly diverse looks and effects. There’s a teeny-tiny flea, an emo goose, and even a few characters from other games—like Epoch, who sprays cars with blocky bullets. The creativity and care put into Crossy Road’s wacky world are unmistakable.
editorialNotes.short: These games are tough, but without a challenge, what's the point of ruling leaderboards?

editorialNotes.standard: The ocean’s your preyground and you’ve gotta keep feeding in this deliciously goofy arcade romp. Rushing from meal to meal—fishes, birds, hapless beachgoers—keeps the pace exhilarating, and the gorgeous environments are a feast for your eyes. Meanwhile, random hazards (mines, pollution, bigger sharks) add a thrilling sense of danger—reminding you that you’re not the only predator in these waters.
